pli-tv-kd16:13.1.1: At one time the Buddha gave many talks about the Monastic Law, spoke in praise of the Monastic Law and of learning the Monastic Law, and he repeatedly praised Venerable Upāli.

pli-tv-kd16:17.2.24: “When you have taken on building work, you should not reserve a dwelling at all times.
pli-tv-kd16:17.2.25: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-kd16:17.2.26: I allow you to reserve it for the three months of the rainy-season residence, but not at other times.”
pli-tv-kd16:17.3.1: At that time monks who had taken on building work left, disrobed, died,
pli-tv-kd16:17.3.3: admitted to having renounced the training,
pli-tv-kd16:17.3.4: admitted to having committed the worst kind of offense,

pli-tv-kd16:17.3.19: admitted to having caused a schism in the Sangha,
pli-tv-kd16:17.3.20: admitted to having caused the Buddha to bleed,
pli-tv-kd16:17.3.23: “If a monk who has taken on building work departs,

pli-tv-kd16:17.3.25: If a monk who has taken on building work disrobes,

pli-tv-kd16:17.3.27: it should be given to another, with the thought, ‘What belongs to the Sangha should not be allowed to deteriorate.’
pli-tv-kd16:17.3.28: If a monk who has taken on building work departs while it is still unfinished,
pli-tv-kd16:17.3.29: it should be given to another, with the thought, ‘What belongs to the Sangha should not be allowed to deteriorate.’
pli-tv-kd16:17.3.30: If a monk who has taken on building work disrobes while it is still unfinished …
pli-tv-kd16:17.3.31: admits to being a hermaphrodite while it is still unfinished,
pli-tv-kd16:17.3.32: it should be given to another, with the thought, ‘What belongs to the Sangha should not be allowed to deteriorate.’
pli-tv-kd16:17.3.33: If a monk who has taken on building work departs when it is finished,
pli-tv-kd16:17.3.34: then it is still for him.
pli-tv-kd16:17.3.35: If a monk who has taken on building work disrobes when it is finished;
pli-tv-kd16:17.3.36: dies when it is finished; admits, when it is finished, to being a novice monk; admits, when it is finished, to having renounced the training; or admits, when it is finished, to having committed the worst kind of offense,
pli-tv-kd16:17.3.37: then the Sangha is the owner.

pli-tv-kd16:17.3.39: then it is still for him.

pli-tv-kd16:18.1.0: 3.4 The prohibition against using requisites where they don’t belong, etc.
pli-tv-kd16:18.1.1: At one time the monks used a certain lay follower’s furniture where it did not belong.
pli-tv-kd16:18.1.2: That lay follower complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-kd16:18.1.3: “How can those venerables use the furniture where it doesn’t belong?”
pli-tv-kd16:18.1.5: “You should not use furniture where it doesn’t belong.
pli-tv-kd16:18.1.6: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”
pli-tv-kd16:18.1.7: Being afraid of wrongdoing, the monks did not take any equipment to the observance-day hall or to meetings, and they sat down on the bare ground.
pli-tv-kd16:18.1.8: Their limbs and robes became dirty.
pli-tv-kd16:18.1.11: At that time a large dwelling belonging to the Sangha was decaying.
pli-tv-kd16:18.1.12: Being afraid of wrongdoing, the monks did not remove the furniture.
pli-tv-kd16:18.1.14: “I allow you to move it for the purpose of protection.”
pli-tv-kd16:19.1.1: On one occasion the Sangha was offered a valuable, woolen furniture cloth.
pli-tv-kd16:19.1.3: “I allow you to make a beneficial trade.”
pli-tv-kd16:19.1.4: On one occasion the Sangha was offered a valuable furniture cloth.
pli-tv-kd16:19.1.6: “I allow you to make a beneficial trade.”
pli-tv-kd16:19.1.7: On one occasion the Sangha was offered a bear skin.
pli-tv-kd16:19.1.9: “I allow you to make it into a doormat.”
pli-tv-kd16:19.1.10: On one occasion the Sangha was offered a round pad.
pli-tv-kd16:19.1.12: “I allow you to make it into a doormat.”
pli-tv-kd16:19.1.13: On one occasion the Sangha was offered a cloth.
pli-tv-kd16:19.1.15: “I allow you to make it into a doormat.”
pli-tv-kd16:20.1.1: At that time there were monks who entered the dwellings with dirty feet.
pli-tv-kd16:20.1.4: “You should not enter a dwelling with dirty feet.
pli-tv-kd16:20.1.5: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”
pli-tv-kd16:20.1.6: At that time there were monks who entered the dwellings with wet feet.
pli-tv-kd16:20.1.9: “You should not enter a dwelling with wet feet.
pli-tv-kd16:20.1.10: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”
pli-tv-kd16:20.1.11: At that time there were monks who entered the dwellings with their sandals on.
pli-tv-kd16:20.1.14: “You should not enter a dwelling with your sandals on.
pli-tv-kd16:20.1.15: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”
pli-tv-kd16:20.2.1: At that time there were monks who spat on treated floors.
pli-tv-kd16:20.2.4: “You should not spit on treated floors.
pli-tv-kd16:20.2.5: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-kd16:20.2.7: At that time the legs of the beds and benches scratched the treated floors. The coloring was spoiled.
pli-tv-kd16:20.2.9: “You should wrap the legs in cloth.”
pli-tv-kd16:20.2.10: At that time there were monks who leaned on treated walls.
pli-tv-kd16:20.2.13: “You should not lean on treated walls.
pli-tv-kd16:20.2.14: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-kd16:20.2.16: The lower edge of the leaning boards scratched the floor and the upper edge the wall.
pli-tv-kd16:20.2.18: “You should wrap the lower and upper edges in cloth.”
pli-tv-kd16:20.2.19: Being afraid of wrongdoing, the monks did not lie down with washed feet.
pli-tv-kd16:20.2.21: “You should spread a sheet and then lie down.”
pli-tv-kd16:21.1.0: 3.5 The allowance for meals for the Sangha, etc.
pli-tv-kd16:21.1.1: When the Buddha had stayed at Āḷavī for as long as he liked, he set out wandering toward Rājagaha.
pli-tv-kd16:21.1.3: he stayed in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.
pli-tv-kd16:21.1.4: At that time Rājagaha was short of food
pli-tv-kd16:21.1.5: and people were not able to make meals for the Sangha.
pli-tv-kd16:21.1.6: Instead they wished to make meals for designated monks, invitational meals, meals for which lots are drawn, half-monthly meals, meals on the observance day, and meals on the day after the observance day.
pli-tv-kd16:21.1.8: “I allow meals for the Sangha, meals for designated monks, invitational meals, meals for which lots are drawn, half-monthly meals, meals on the observance days, and meals on the days after the observance day.”
pli-tv-kd16:21.1.9.0: 3.6 The appointment of a designator of meals
pli-tv-kd16:21.1.9.1: At that time the monks from the group of six took the best meals for themselves and gave the inferior ones to the other monks.
pli-tv-kd16:21.1.11: “You should appoint a monk who has five qualities as the designator of meals:
pli-tv-kd16:21.1.12: he is not swayed by desire, ill will, confusion, or fear, and he knows what has and has not been designated.
pli-tv-kd16:21.1.13: And he should be appointed like this.
pli-tv-kd16:21.1.14: First a monk should be asked, and then a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:
pli-tv-kd16:21.1.15: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-kd16:21.1.16: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should appoint monk so-and-so as designator of meals.
pli-tv-kd16:21.1.18: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-kd16:21.1.19: The Sangha appoints monk so-and-so as designator of meals.
pli-tv-kd16:21.1.20: Any monk who approves of appointing monk so-and-so as designator of meals should remain silent.
pli-tv-kd16:21.1.21: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.
pli-tv-kd16:21.1.22: The Sangha has appointed monk so-and-so as designator of meals.
pli-tv-kd16:21.1.23: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”
pli-tv-kd16:21.1.24: The monks who were designator of meals thought,
pli-tv-kd16:21.1.27: “You should mark the tickets and make a heap of them, and then designate the meals.”
pli-tv-kd16:21.2.0: 3.7 The appointment of assigners of dwellings, etc.
pli-tv-kd16:21.2.1: At that time there was no assigner of dwellings …
pli-tv-kd16:21.2.8: Because it was not shared out, the fresh food perished.
pli-tv-kd16:21.2.10: “You should appoint a monk who has five qualities as the distributor of fresh foods:
pli-tv-kd16:21.2.11: he is not swayed by desire, ill will, confusion, or fear, and he knows what has and has not been shared out.
pli-tv-kd16:21.2.12: And he should be appointed like this.

pli-tv-kd16:21.2.15: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should appoint monk so-and-so as distributor of fresh foods.
pli-tv-kd16:21.2.17: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-kd16:21.2.18: The Sangha appoints monk so-and-so as distributor of fresh foods.
pli-tv-kd16:21.2.19: Any monk who approves of appointing monk so-and-so as distributor of fresh foods should remain silent.
pli-tv-kd16:21.2.20: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd16:21.3.0: 3.8 The appointment of distributors of minor requisites
pli-tv-kd16:21.3.1: At that time there were minor requisites in the storeroom.
pli-tv-kd16:21.3.3: “You should appoint a monk who has five qualities as the distributor of minor requisites:
pli-tv-kd16:21.3.4: he is not swayed by desire, ill will, confusion, or fear, and he knows what has and has not been distributed.
pli-tv-kd16:21.3.5: And he should be appointed like this.
pli-tv-kd16:21.3.6: First a monk should be asked, and then a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:
pli-tv-kd16:21.3.7: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-kd16:21.3.8: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should appoint monk so-and-so as distributor of minor requisites.
pli-tv-kd16:21.3.10: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-kd16:21.3.11: The Sangha appoints monk so-and-so as distributor of minor requisites.
pli-tv-kd16:21.3.12: Any monk who approves of appointing monk so-and-so as distributor of minor requisites should remain silent.
pli-tv-kd16:21.3.13: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.
pli-tv-kd16:21.3.14: The Sangha has appointed monk so-and-so as distributor of minor requisites.
pli-tv-kd16:21.3.15: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”
pli-tv-kd16:21.3.16: The monk who is the distributor of minor requisites should give out, one by one: needles, knives, sandals, belts, shoulder straps, water filters, water strainers; and robe material for long inter-panel strips, short inter-panel strips, large panels, medium-sized panels, lengthwise borders, and crosswise borders.
pli-tv-kd16:21.3.17: If the Sangha has ghee, oil, honey, or syrup, he should give it out for a single use.
pli-tv-kd16:21.3.18: If it is needed again, he should give it out again.
pli-tv-kd16:21.3.19.0: 3.9 The appointment of distributors of rainy-season bathing cloths, etc.
pli-tv-kd16:21.3.19.1: At that time there was no distributor of rainy-season bathing cloths …

pli-tv-kd16:21.3.26: he is not swayed by desire, ill will, confusion, or fear, and he knows who is and is not supervised.
pli-tv-kd16:21.3.27: And he should be appointed like this.

pli-tv-kd16:21.3.30: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should appoint monk so-and-so as supervisor of novice monks.
pli-tv-kd16:21.3.32: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-kd16:21.3.33: The Sangha appoints monk so-and-so as supervisor of novice monks.

pli-tv-kd16:21.3.197: He has conquered all and knows the world,
pli-tv-kd16:21.3.198: The Leader intent on what’s beneficial:
pli-tv-kd16:21.3.199: It’s for the sake of shelter and happiness,
